content.description: The holds are small but solid, ranging from crimps, rails, and pockets. Climbing it barefoot is doable, but tape up your big toes to prevent cuts and whatnot. Climbing the route with shoes will make your life a lot easier. If you don't have a crashpad, have someone spot you on your first few runs, because falling will definitely lead to sprained or broken angles, as the ground is very rocky. After a few runs, you will get a hang of where the holds are and cruise up the route; however, I somehow climbed it slightly differently each time!
content.protection: Have someone spot you! The ground is rocky and sharp.
content.location: Start at the left corner of the face, and traverse diagonally up and right to the top.
